snippet: By excluding the aesthetic dimension from our analyses of militant texts, we miss a crucial opportunity to confront the humanity of their authors.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Faisal Devji observes that poetry has long been a part of Muslim radicalism, a fact that is underscored by poetry found in the cache of documents found in Osama bin Laden's Pakistan hideaway; maintains that the aesthetic dimension of militant texts written by Taliban and Qaeda fighters offers an opportunity to confront the humanity of the authors.
lead_paragraph: By excluding the aesthetic dimension from our analyses of militant texts, we miss a crucial opportunity to confront the humanity of their authors.

headline.main: The Poetry of Al Qaeda and the Taliban
headline.print_headline: The Poetry of Al Qaeda and the Taliban
